page.title: 01Analysis of Land Cover
page.content: { The area is predominantly agricultural 76% of the land being used for crops or grazing. The main crop in the early part of the year is potatoes the second crop is usually cauliflowers or cabbages. A few fields are reserved for the growing of daffodils both flowers and bulbs. The grassland is used entirely as feed for Jersey cows, the only breed allowed on the island, either as pasture or for hay as winter feed.Only 15% of the area is used for residential, recreational or community purposes. The remainder is either woodland or inland water. Being a farming area there is not sufficient work for the local population, therefore many travel to work in St. Helier or to the airport which is nearby.
